org.overture.core.tests

Class ParamStandardTest<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.overture.core.tests.AbsResultTest<R>
      • org.overture.core.tests.ParamStandardTest<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - 

    public abstract class ParamStandardTest<R>
extends AbsResultTest<R>
    Standard test in the new Overture test framework. This class runs tests on (correct) VDM sources and compares them with stored result files. It is meant to be subclassed as a way to quickly create your own test suites.

    A comparison method for results must be provided. JSON-based serialization of results is fully automated and deserialization is close to it.

    These tests are meant to be run as parameterized JUnit test and so any subclass must be annotated with @RunWith(Parameterized.class).

    This class also has a type parameter R that represents the output of the functionality under test. You should create a specific R type for your functionality and write some kind of transformation between your native output type and R.
    Author:
    ldc

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParamStandardTest

        public ParamStandardTest(String nameParameter,
                         String inputParameter,
                         String resultParameter)
        Constructor for the test. In order to use JUnit parameterized tests, the inputs for this class must be supplied by a public static method. Subclasses must implement this method themselves and annotate with @Parameters(name = "{index} : {0}").

        The PathsProvider.computePaths(String...) method produces the correct input for this constructor and should be called with the root folder of your tests inputs as its argument.
        Parameters:
        nameParameter - the name of the test. Normally derived from the test input file
        inputParameter - file path for the VDM source to test
        resultParameter - test result file

    • Method Detail

      • testCase

        public void testCase()
              throws ParserException,
                     LexException,
                     IOException
        Execute this test. Constructs the AST for the model and processes it via processModel(List). Then loads a stored result via AbsResultTest.deSerializeResult(String). Finally, the two results are compared with AbsResultTest.compareResults(Object, Object).

        If the test is run in update mode, then no comparison is made. Instead, the new result is saved.

        This test is not designed to run on VDM sources with syntax or type errors. The test will fail if the source fails to parse or type check. While this behavior can be overridden, we suggest looking at ParamFineGrainTest if you need to cope with these errors.
        Throws:
        IOException
        LexException
        ParserException

      • processModel

        public abstract R processModel(List<INode> ast)
        Analyse a model. This method is called during test execution to produce the actual result. It must, of course, be overridden to perform whatever analysis the functionality under test performs.

        The output of this method must be of type R, the result type this test runs on. You will will likely need to have a conversion method between the output of your analysis and R.
        Parameters:
        ast - the model to process
        Returns:
        the output of the analysis
